name: idealized
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
involving thinking of or representing someone or something as better than that person or thing really is: The film presents a very idealized view of 19th-century Ireland. She became an icon and an idealized symbol of women's achievement. See
idealize
More examplesFewer examplesHistorical paintings were rarely idealized for the sake of beauty.We were presented with an idealized image of a 19th-century port town.She argues that the idealized plots with happy endings in these novels are, in fact, allegories.
